A lot of game for a small Android price!  -Crafting  Crafting is simple and getting the ingredients isn't purely based on RNG. That is something I absolutely love about this game. Drop rates are amazing as well, so when you're trying to optimize gear, you don't spend a week trying to get 1 item like in MMOs. The developers really make it so that you're not feeling like it's a boring chore.   - Combat  The combat system in Portal Knights isn't anything special. There is nothing wrong with that, however, you can also dodge. This one additional mechanic really makes the combat enjoyable.  - Story  Typical simple story. Not much to say.  -Character Customization  I love it. You can change the appearance of your character again after you create it. Hers an idea for you. After beating like the highest levels you should gain 
access to a type of portal that every time you enter it you go into a

Finally, a block/crafting game where the combat...wait for it...doesn't 
suck! Its about freaking time and I don't know why this hasn't been done 
over and over. Active dodging or blocking is something both Minecraft and 
Block Story never really bothered with and its a shame. Also, this game 
does a really good job of randomizing it's world's caves and dungeons and 
the large universe takes a long time to get through. As refreshing as this 
is, this game still falls short on a few things. First of all, as far as I 
can tell there is no pause button and it's downright infuriating at times. 
Secondly, there are only three fun but mostly easy major bosses and their 
very hard hardmode equivalents...you gotta do better than that in this day 
and age when especially when your the company behind Terraria. At least 
make a lot more mini bosses or hallowed prince like events! Thirdly, its 
always bugged me when games do infinite arrows for the ranger class...not 
realistic. They should be limited and get to use light weapons in my 
opinion. Lastly, there's still room for improvements like more moves (like
